page.title: 10GEORGE ANGUS BENTHAM
page.content: Spinning and weaving originally cottage industry in Bentham. It is reported Nelson's flagship HMS Victory sails woven here. 1750 High Mill built. 1785 Low Mill built. Bentham linen much sought in London. 1866 became Ltd Co. Bentham linen trade ceased 1883. 1875 became Bentham Spinning and Weaving Co. After several changes factory included a hose and belting department. 1904 taken over by George Angus, made woven fire hose, Telemite brake linings (1920-70). Foam pipes, foam inductors and fire fighting foam concentrates now used at NASA. Largest fire hose plant in the World. Other factories in Boston, New York and Johannesburg. Fire engines made in Southampton. 1969 Dunlop took over. 1979 Guthrie's became owners. 350 of the workforce live within five miles
